Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
description: ['One-lane of the U.S. 50 Middle Bridge will open starting Wednesday, July 3 at 6:30 am. Pilot cars will lead smaller vehicles across the bridge one direction at a time between 6:30 am and 6:30 pm each day through Sunday, July 7. Access will change July 8.', 'Phase one of this major road improvement project is underway with alternating one-way traffic (expect 15-minute delays, multiple stops) starting at the park entrance on Hwy 347.', 'Road construction starts May 13, 2024, with alternating one-way closures Mon-Fri 8:00am-6:30pm. The project is located on US Highway 50 between mileposts 123 and 127, approx. 30 miles east of Montrose, CO. Refer to www.us50info.com for updated information', 'Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the visitor center. Drive with extra caution. More road work in 2025.']
title: ['Limited Opening of U.S. Highway 50 Middle Bridge from July 3-7 - East of Black Canyon', 'Road Construction Update - Delays and Closures in Effect', 'Highway 50 - Little Blue Creek Canyon Construction', 'Road Construction at Black Canyon South Rim - 2024 and 2025']

description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.', 'El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']
title: ['West and East Border Roads closed for public safety', 'Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed', 'Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only']

description: ['Cades Cove Loop Road is motor vehicle-free all day on Wednesdays from May through September to provide opportunities for cyclists and pedestrians to experience Cades Cove without motor vehicles.', 'All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).', 'Several trails in the park are temporarily closed. Please check the "Trail and Backcountry Closures, Warnings & Cautions" section of the Current Road, Facility, Trail & Backcountry Updates page for further details.']
title: ['Cades Cove closed Wednesdays to motor vehicles', 'Most visitors need a parking tag', 'Trail Advisory']

description: ['The following are closed to the public through 8/31/2024 to protect sensitive resources: the heads of Burro Wash & Fivemile Wash continuing east 2 miles, Shinob Canyon and any route descending into Shinob, including Na-gah, Nighthawk, & Timpie.']
title: ['Seasonal Canyon Closures']

description: ['In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']

description: ['Wilderness Road is closed from Tennessee Road Trail to the trail that leads up to Gap Cave for scheduled maintenance work.']
title: ['Trail Closure']

description: ['Towpath Trail will be closed for repairs starting at Station Road and extending 2,500 feet north from 7 a.m. and 5 p.m, weekdays. No detour is provided. The anticipated opening date is late January. Towpath will remain open southbound from Station Road.']
title: ['Towpath Trail Temporary Closure']

description: ['Reds Meadow Road & shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile, will be closed for construction from Sundays at 11 pm through Fridays at 9 am (except holidays) during the summer 2024 season. The road also closes Fridays starting September 15.']
title: ['Reds Meadow Road Access Restrictions in 2024']

description: ['The highway 137 bridge landing sustained flood damage in 2019 and the landing restoration by NDOT has been completed. The area is smaller than in the past and the access to the water is steeper. Use caution when accessing the landing']
title: ['Landing at Hwy 137']

title: ['Salmi Road Entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail out of the Kabetogama Community Remains Temporarily Closed.']

description: ['Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.']
title: ['Navigation']

description: ['Road construction in the park from April 1 to mid-August 2024. Weekly updates on construction activities and locations in the park will be posted on the Bighorn Canyon Facebook page. Visitors can also call 307-548-5406 for current conditions.']
title: ['Road Construction Delays April 1 to Mid-August 2024']

description: ["Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity."]
title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins']

description: ['Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.']
title: ['Dangerous Highway Crossing']

description: ['The Green River Ferry Status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information please call the Green River Ferry Hotline at (270) 758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter feed. 2 vehicle limit.', 'The Green River Ferry is open to vehicle traffic but still closed to trailers and recreational vehicles due to low water conditions. The closure will last until the river depth increases to safe levels to transport vehicles.']
title: ['Green River Ferry Status', 'The Green River Ferry Is Open to Vehicle Traffic, But..']

description: ['Due to nesting shorebirds, the beach access at the end of Snail Road in Provincetown is temporarily closed to the public. Visitors may still walk the trail, but will need to turn around when they reach the closure.']
title: ['Snail Road Beach Access Closed']

description: ['Visitors should expect disruptions to their experience at the park this year due to a number of major infrastructure projects involving intermittent closures to campgrounds, roads, and trailheads, For more information, click "More" or call 775-234-7331.']
title: ['Infrastructure Projects to Cause Closures and Disruptions']

description: ['Due to washout and bad road conditions Slant Rock Road has been closed to all traffic aside from hikers and bikers. To access Slant Rock, park your vehicle at the hunting inspection station off of Road 103.']
title: ['Slant Rock Road Closed to Vehicular Traffic']

description: ['County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.']
title: ['County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday']

description: ['Due to damage from heavy rains, some roads may require high clearance or 4x4 vehicles for passage. Please use caution when approaching and driving on roadways. Trailers over 30 ft not advised.']
title: ['Road Damage']

description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']
title: ['Trail Conditions']

description: ['Road traffic is restricted: anyone not camping in the park will be turned around. All facilities are currently closed. All frontcountry trails in the park entrance area are closed.', 'The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 15 (Savage River) for personal vehicles. Vehicle travel beyond Savage River in summer is mainly limited to transit and tour buses.', 'Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.']
title: ['Riley Fire Impacts to Park Operations', 'Denali Park Road Information', 'Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide']

description: ['Lassen National Park Highway connecting the north and south park entrances is now OPEN to through traffic. Please drive safely and obey all posted speed limits.']
title: ['Lassen National Park Highway is now OPEN']

description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']
title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']

Park Full Name: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]
title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']

Park Full Name: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve
description: ['Please do not rely upon GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Craters of the Moon. Please note that the Visitor Center at 1266 Craters Loop Road is located just off U.S. Highway 20/26/93 and is not accessed via any unpaved roads.']
title: ['Navigation']

description: ['On 2/29 Eastbound Morris St. will be closed down to one lane starting at Ridgedale Ave for about 140 days. Westbound Morris St will closed to all traffic starting at the intersection of Ford Ave and Taft Lane. Please plan alternate routes.', "Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]
title: ['Morristown road closures beginning 29 February', 'Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']

description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']
title: ['Secure trash and food']

description: ['The Marshall Hall Access Road is closed due to construction. This road connects the Marshall Hall ruins to Marshall Hall Rd. The main road remains open.']
title: ['Road Closure: Marshall Hall Access Road']

description: ['Do not drive on Hart Mine Road. Missing culverts are hazardous for all vehicles and road is subject to sudden collapse. Please do not drive around signed barricades.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.', 'Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.']
title: ['Hart Mine Road CLOSED due to collapsed culverts', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely', 'Use Caution on Roads with Debris']

description: ['Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.', 'GPS apps on mobile devices may direct visitors to "Grand Canyon-Parashant" who type "Grand Canyon" into their driving directions. Roads across Parashant require 4-wheel drive and all-terrain tires. There are no visitor services or cell reception here.']
title: ['Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.', 'Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about GPS navigation using mobile devices.']

Park Full Name: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument
description: ['Don’t get your vehicle stuck at the Painted Hills! We want you and your RV or large bus to enjoy your trip. Travel trailers or large buses are not recommended beyond the Overlook Trail at Painted Hills due to limited turning radius.']
title: ['Painted Hills- Large RV or Travel Trailer not Recommended Beyond Overlook Trail']

description: ['Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.', 'Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.', "Due to weather related incidents, North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle are closed to vehicular and recreational traffic. Entering these areas is prohibited. A portion of Grant Avenue is open for touring."]
title: ['National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians', 'Louisiana Circle Closed', "North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle Closed"]

description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. description: ['Tamiami Trail and State Road 9336 both have ongoing construction which may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly.', 'Roadwork is underway along State Road 9336 leading to the Homestead entrance of the park, approaching the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center. Drivers may experience short delays and should watch for personnel, construction equipment, and slowdowns.', "Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs."]
title: ['Click on "caution" alerts below for important details on accessing the park', "Road construction on approach to park's Homestead entrance", 'Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail']

description: ['Closed roads may be open to non-motorized vehicles like bicycles. CHECK SIGNS on closed road gates before proceeding. During snow plowing operations or when otherwise posted, park roads are closed to all use, including hiking, bicycling, skiing, etc.']
title: ['Always check signs on closed road gates before recreating; roads closed to all use if work underway.']

description: ['Battle Road Trail between Olive Stow Boardwalk to Brooks Village is closed until mid-July 2024. This will allow for the completion of a trail re-route. Entering closures is prohibited. Please plan accordingly.', 'Rolling Trail Closures and Parking Lot Closures on Battle Road Trail and at the North Bridge Trail will occur in the spring, summer and fall of 2024. Entering closures is prohibited.']
title: ['Trail Closures on Battle Road Trail', 'Trail Closures in place to allow for trail improvements']

description: ['Due to high to extreme fire danger, the following are prohibited: fire, charcoal, and propane grills; smoking except inside personal vehicles; and open flames and cooking stoves in the backcountry. Carlsbad Cavern and the visitor center are open.', 'Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. For updates on the road and trails, click "More" below.']
title: ['High to Extreme Fire Danger: Prohibited Activities', 'Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage']

Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park
description: ['Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.']
title: ['Hiking in Gold Mine Tract']

description: ['Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may not stop or exit their vehicle in this area. Area south of dunes drive closed to all traffic.', 'From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']
title: ['Dunes Drive Safety Corridor', 'Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']

description: ['Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended']
title: ['Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?']

description: ['Lincoln County will be closing a portion of Miles Creston from Highway 2 to Copenhaver Road beginning July 10, 2024, through December 1, 2024. If you are accessing Lincoln Mill, Hawk Creek, or Seven Bays you may need to find an alternate route.', 'Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.']
title: ['Partial Miles Creston Road Closure begins on July 10, 2024', 'Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area']

Park Full Name: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument
description: ['There is an impassable washout on the Seboeis Connector Road (46.07214,-68.63190) within the Seboeis Parcel of Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument.']
title: ['Impassable Washout on Sebeois Connector Road']

description: ['The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.']
title: ['Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.']

description: ['Summer season brings hot temperatures and monsoons. Bring water, snacks, and sun protection for your visit. Check weather conditions before hiking. Severe lighting and flash floods can occur. When driving in the area, avoid flooded roadways.', 'There will be construction on the four-mile section of highway outside of the park entrance until August 19, 2024. There may be periods of brief delay when entering or exiting the park.', "Vehicles longer than 24 feet are not permitted past the visitor center on Bonita Canyon Drive. Vehicles up to 29 feet are still allowed to stay in the campground, but can't go further. Parking for large vehicles and trailers is available at Faraway Ranch."]
title: ['Visit Safely in the Summer', 'Highway Road Construction Outside Monument', 'Vehicle Length Limits']

description: ['Due to road and parking lot repaving, expect periodic closures of park parking areas and roads.']
title: ['Expect Intermittent Closures']

description: ["This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805"]
title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']

description: ['The section of trail from the Dune Park Train Station to East State Park Road is in very poor condition with large, deep puddles of standing water and sections with larger gravel stones. Ride this section with extreme caution.']
title: ['Poor Trail Conditions on the Calumet Bike Trail']

description: ['Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.']
title: ['Warning about GPS Systems!']

description: ['Campobello Island is located in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. The physical address for the Visitor Centre is: 459 Route 774 Welshpool, New Brunswick, Canada E5E 1A4']
title: ['Roosevelt Campobello International Park is located in Welshpool.']

description: ['Highway 245 outside the parks is under construction by CalTrans. It is scheduled to be closed through July 4th, 2024. It is not possible to reach or leave the Grant Grove area using Highway 245. Alternate routes are available.']
title: ['Highway 245 is Closed for Construction and Cannot Be Used to Reach or Leave the Grant Grove Area']

description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']
title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']

description: ['Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.']
title: ['Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians']

description: ['As of July 1, water at Hosmer Campground in the Summit District is shutoff for an emergency waterline repair. Water is expected to be out through July 2. There is water available 24-hours at Headquarters Visitor Center one mile up the road.', 'Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.']
title: ['No Water at Hosmer Campground', 'Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway']

description: ['Vegetation will be cleared from the shoulders of North Shore Road (Route 20) over the next 4 weeks. Intermittent single lane closures may be in place during this time. Thank you for using caution while driving and helping to keep staff and each other safe']
title: ['Temporary lane closures on North Shore Road (Route 20)']

description: ['Use caution on unpaved roads in the preserve: Timber Slough is washed out; Franklin Lake and McQueens Landing are flooded. Damaged bridge on Sunflower Road. Big Sandy Trail has multiple washouts and fallen trees. Contact us for updates.']
title: ['Storm Damage']

description: ['All Off-Road Vehicle Trails will be temporarily closed for recreational access from Monday, June 3rd until Friday, August 2nd. Please click the link to view the official closure order.']
title: ['2024 Off Road Vehicle Closure Order']

description: ['Later this summer, Grand View Point Overlook, Grand View Point Trail, and 0.3 mi (0.5 km) of park road will close 6 am Mondays to 4 pm Thursdays for a total of eight weeks. The closure applies to all uses, including vehicles, tour buses, motorcycles,', 'All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1, March 15, or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.', 'Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.']
title: ['Grand View Point closing for construction weekdays late July through September', 'Seasonal climbing closures in effect', 'Expect long lines to enter the park']

description: ['There is a temporary closure of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge due to construction along the George Washington Memorial Parkway. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.', 'Please see our partner sites to find the most up-to-date information on closures, re-routes, or conditions along the Trail.']
title: ['Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure along George Washington Memorial Parkway', 'Some facilities closed along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail']

description: ['Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.']
title: ['South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28']

description: ['The Going-to-the-Sun Road is fully open for the 2024 summer season. The road may now be accessed by motorized vehicles over Logan Pass from both the West Glacier and St. Mary entrances.']
title: ['Going-to-the-Sun Road Opens for the Season']

description: ['The National Park Service is imposing a temporary closure of a portion of the Potomac Heritage National Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge during construction activities. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.']
title: ['Potomac Heritage National Trail Closed at Glebe Road for construction activities']

description: ['South Cut Trail is closed between the main road and Killman Field trail due to washout along the trail. Detour for that section is along Killman Field trail. South Cut trail from Killman Field trail to the beach is open.']
title: ['South Cut trail Partially Closed']

description: ['Pavement preservation is taking place on Highway 399/Earle Bowden Way. One lane closure and flaggers are in place.']
title: ['Highway 399/Earle Bowden Way Road Work']

description: ['Due to resource theft and damage from unauthorized off-road travel in and around the campground, the 277N Campground is closed. It is expected to reopen September 1, 2024.']
title: ['277N Campground Closed to Tentatively Reopen September 1']

description: ['To avoid traffic congestion, visitors should access Sand Beach via the Park Loop Road by following signs from the park’s Hulls Cove entrance on Route 3 (Eden Street) or Cadillac Mountain entrance on Route 233 (Eagle Lake Road) in Bar Harbor.', 'Due to storm damage, vehicles must access Seawall Campground, and Wonderland and Ship Harbor trails via the west end of Route 102A (Harbor Drive) in Bass Harbor. Route 102A (Seawall Road) is closed to through traffic at the seawall until further notice.', 'The trail crew will be removing old road asphalt with heavy equipment to restore the area to a more natural state. Hikers will be able to walk along the roadway of Great Meadow Drive to access trails into Sieur de Monts area.']
title: ['Some Streets in Downtown Bar Harbor Closed for Construction Through Summer', 'Route 102A (Seawall Road) in Southwest Harbor is closed to through traffic', 'Great Meadow Loop Trail closed along Great Meadow Drive']

Park Full Name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site
description: ['The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. A 6-passenger accessible shuttle runs daily every 20 minutes from 9:40 am to 4:20 pm, from the main parking lot, on Little River Road, to the Sandburg Home and farm area.']
title: ['Pedestrian Bridge at Front Lake is Closed']

description: ['Fire restrictions are in place at Montezuma Castle National Monument and its Sub-Unit Montezuma Well. Smoking is prohibited, including Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (E.N.D.S.), except when inside a personal vehicle.']
title: ['Fire Restrictions in Place - NO Smoking']

description: ['Roadwork at the Sanford-Yake area will begin on Monday, May 6, 2024. Expect delays.']
title: ['Road Construction at Sanford-Yake']

description: ['Due to the narrow roadway & tight turn, RVs, mobile homes, charter buses, delivery trucks, or vehicles with trailers are prohibited from the crest of Monument Hill. Check for information about parking at the Visitor Center upon your arrival.']
title: ['Notice to travelers to National Cemetery']

Park Full Name: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site
description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]
title: ['A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort']

Park Full Name: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area
description: ['Franklin Canyon Park is open at the north (Mulholland) entrance to pedestrian and bicycle access only. No vehicular access until further notice due to hazardous conditions. South entrance is open to vehicles. No through traffic.']
title: ['Franklin Canyon Park is Open.']

Park Full Name: Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area
description: ['NPS work crews continue their work to clear roads and trails of numerous hazardous trees from the weather event on May 26. Due to safety concerns, numerous trails are temporarily closed to pedestrian, bike, and horse traffic due to extensive tree damage.']
title: ['Temporary Trail Closure During Ongoing Storm Recovery']

description: ['Due to increased visitation, parking lots often fill up early. Visitors need to be aware that parking for larger vehicles is very limited. RVs using "tow dollies" may have to unhook towed vehicles in order to turn around in the parking lot on busy days.']
title: ['RVs, Trailers and Other Oversized Vehicles (Limited Parking)']

description: ["On Monday, July 1st from 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm, the park is seeking feedback on the limiting of vehicle and bicycle use on the Kennesaw Mountain Dr. to the top of Big Kennesaw Mountain. The open house will be held at the park's visitor center."]
title: ['Public Comment Open House on Proposed Limit of Mountain Rd. Access to Vehicles/Bicycles']

description: ['Due to July 4th activities, the parking lot of the Yorktown Battlefield will be closed to visitors the morning of July 4th. title: ['4th of July parking and Battlefield Tour Road alert.', 'Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']

description: ['Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.']
title: ['Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended']

description: ["Please be advised of potential delays or route obstructions to the Wilson's Creek National Battlefield Entrance from Hwy ZZ starting Monday, September 18th. Entering Wilson's Creek National Battlefield from Farm Road 182 via Battlefield may be faster."]
title: ['Occasional lane closures and traffic delays due to construction at Hwy ZZ & Farm Rd 182']

description: ['Cedar Breaks is undergoing a road preservation project this summer. From July - mid-August, be prepared for any potential delays, closures or noise along the main park road, parking lots, and campground.']
title: ['Road and Parking Lot Construction']

description: ['Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.']
title: ['Vehicle Entrance Reservation Not Needed']

title: ['Use Caution with GPS Navigation']

Park Full Name: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site
description: ['In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.']
title: ['8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park']

description: ['Increased rain and beaver dam activity this year flooded the Poplar Creek Crossing along the Grand Portage Trail. Please use caution as you pass through the water. Park staff is in the process of determining a drier route.']
title: ['Flooding on the Grand Portage Trail at Poplar Creek']

description: ['A geotechnical investigation to improve safety and ensure emergency vehicle access will require a full Maryland Heights trail closure lasting not more than four days. Please consider other trails in the interim.']
title: ['UPDATE: Maryland Heights Trail to CLOSE beginning 7/11/24']

description: ['Bandelier’s mandatory shuttle service begins on June 27 and will run to October 16. Visitors may drive their private vehicles directly to the Bandelier Visitor Center before 9 am or after 3 pm.', 'Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.']

description: ['Sections of Drown Road (trail) at Fort Baker will be closed intermittently in late June through July for the installation of telecom infrastructure. description: ['Cascade River Road is closed at milepost 20 (Eldorado parking lot) three miles before the trailhead. Cascade River Road usually opens in mid-summer depending on snow and road damage. Foot and bicycle traffic is permitted beyond the gate.', 'The gate at Hozomeen will remain closed to vehicle access from Canada. Winnebago Flats and the upper Hozomeen campgrounds will remain closed. For more information visit the news release on summer operations.', 'Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.']

description: ['The main park road is fully open to Rainbow Point (Mile 18 of 18). All park roads are currently open for the season. During snowstorms the road may temporarily close at Mile 3 for snowplow operations.']

description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

description: ['Numerous highway construction projects are occurring in the Black Hills and may impact trip planning to the Memorial. Please consult with South Dakota 511 to minimize delays or other inconveniences.']

description: ['The Service Road/Trail from the Lighthouse parking lot toward the lighthouse and the road between the fort and visitor center hills are closed to due scheduled construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.']

description: ['Starting July 12, the Highway 101 Elwha Bridge will close for construction. Travelers should use State Routes 112 and 113 to access Lake Crescent and Barnes Point. Little River Rd will provide access to Madison Falls Trailhead and Olympic Hot Springs Rd.']

description: ['West Rim Drive from Rim Village to Discovery Point (1 mile) is now OPEN for travel. The rest of Rim Drive and North Entrance Road will not reopen until sometime in June or July as plow operators gradually clear sections of large quantities of snow.']

description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. description: ['The highway 137 bridge landing sustained flood damage in 2019 and the landing restoration by NDOT has been completed. The area is smaller than in the past and the access to the water is steeper. Use caution when accessing the landing']

description: ['Due to storm damage, vehicles must access Seawall Campground, and Wonderland and Ship Harbor trails via the west end of Route 102A (Harbor Drive) in Bass Harbor. description: ['In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']

description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.', 'High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']

description: ['Phase one of this major road improvement project is underway with alternating one-way traffic (expect 15-minute delays, multiple stops) starting at the park entrance on Hwy 347. The project is located on US Highway 50 between mileposts 123 and 127, approx. 30 miles east of Montrose, CO. Refer to www.us50info.com for updated information', 'Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Please plan alternate routes.', "Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]

description: ['Later this summer, Grand View Point Overlook, Grand View Point Trail, and 0.3 mi (0.5 km) of park road will close 6 am Mondays to 4 pm Thursdays for a total of eight weeks. The closure applies to all uses, including vehicles, tour buses, motorcycles,', 'The White Rim Road can become impassable at Upheaval Wash when the Green River is above 14,000 CFS. Monitor conditions of the river before proceeding with your trip. If the road is flooded and you cannot pass, you must turn around.', 'All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1, March 15, or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.', 'Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.']
title: ['Grand View Point closing for construction weekdays July through September', 'White Rim Road may become impassable at Upheaval Wash', 'Seasonal climbing closures in effect', 'Expect long lines to enter the park']

description: ['Visitors should expect disruptions to their experience at the park this year due to a number of major infrastructure projects involving intermittent closures to campgrounds, roads, and trailheads, For more information, click "More" or call 775-234-7331.']

description: ['The highway 137 bridge landing sustained flood damage in 2019 and the landing restoration by NDOT has been completed. The area is smaller than in the past and the access to the water is steeper. Use caution when accessing the landing']

description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]
title: ['A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort']

description: ['Be alert, especially this time of year around Mammoth Hot Springs. Elk calves may be hidden close to buildings, under or next to vehicles, and around blind corners. You must remain at least 25 yards from all wildlife. If an elk charges, retreat!', 'Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.']
title: ['Elk With Calves Are Extremely Dangerous', 'Vehicle Entrance Reservation Not Needed']

description: ['Do not drive on Hart Mine Road. Missing culverts are hazardous for all vehicles and road is subject to sudden collapse. Please do not drive around signed barricades.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.', 'Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.']
title: ['Hart Mine Road CLOSED due to collapsed culverts', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely', 'Use Caution on Roads with Debris']

description: ['Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.']
title: ['Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed']

description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures', 'The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island closed to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18']

description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. description: ['The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. description: ['In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']
title: ['South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available', 'Parking is not permitted on the Kyles Landing Road (County Road 56)', 'Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches']

Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
description: ['CO Dept. of Transportation has closed US Highway 50 in both directions between County Road 26 and Red Creek Road (42 to 44 miles east of Montrose), from mile marker 136 to 138, for bridge work. Check https://www.codot.gov/news/media/overview for updates.', 'Phase one of this major road improvement project starts April 1, 2024 with alternating one-way traffic (up to 30-minute delays) starting at the park entrance on Hwy 347. Tomichi Point parking lot and viewpoint will be closed until at least mid-May.', 'Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the visitor center. Drive with extra caution. More road work in 2025.', 'Road construction and closures will continue in 2024. The project is located on US Highway 50 between mileposts 123 and 127, approx. 30 miles east of Montrose, Colorado. Refer to www.us50info.com for updated construction information.']
title: ['U.S. HIGHWAY 50 CLOSURE - EAST of BLACK CANYON', 'Road Construction Update - Delays and Closures Start April 2024', 'Road Construction at Black Canyon South Rim - 2024 and 2025', 'Highway 50 Construction']

description: ['Visitors should expect disruptions to their experience at the park this year due to a number of major infrastructure projects involving intermittent closures to campgrounds, roads, and trailheads, For more information, click "More" or call 775-234-7331.', 'The Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive is closed at Osceola Ditch Trailhead, about 4.5 miles up. description: ['Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.']
title: ['Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway']

description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']
title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']

description: ['Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. For updates on the road and trails, click "More" below.']
title: ['Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage']

description: ['The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. A 6-passenger accessible shuttle runs daily every 20 minutes from 9:40 am to 4:20 pm, from the main parking lot, on Little River Road, to the Sandburg Home and farm area.']

description: ['Franklin Canyon Park is CLOSED until further notice at both entrances. Park is CLOSED to all vehicles and pedestrians at both entrances due to hazardous conditions.']

title: ['Bridge Replacement on Hopetown Rd. to Affect Access to Hopeton Earthworks']

description: ['To avoid traffic congestion, visitors should access Sand Beach via the Park Loop Road by following signs from the park’s Hulls Cove entrance on Route 3 (Eden Street) or Cadillac Mountain entrance on Route 233 (Eagle Lake Road) in Bar Harbor.', 'Route 102A (Seawall Road) is closed to through traffic until further notice due to storm damage. All vehicle, bicycle, and pedestrian access is prohibited during the closure.', 'Jordan Pond Road is closed to through traffic as part of a bridge repair project. Stanley Brook Road will remain open to provide access the Jordan Pond area.', "Acadia's historic carriage roads are now open only to pedestrians. They remain closed to all other uses, such has cycling and horses, to protect them during spring thaw, also known as “mud season.” Watch for further updates as conditions allow."]

description: ["You were redirected to this site from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route because of a sunset clause in the Trail's federal legislation, the NPS lost its legislative authority to manage the trail after 9-30-2011."]

description: ['On May 8th, 2024, an NPS arborist team will be removing hazard trees from within the park. Some of the trees are near the park road and will require temporary closure during operations. Please heed any park staff and do not enter areas signed as closed.']

description: ['McAfee Knob/Route 311 parking area along the A.T. in Catawba will be closed Thursday, November 30. The lot is being closed to allow for the construction of a new pedestrian footbridge over Route 311.']

description: ['Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.']
title: ['Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians']

description: ['The Calumet Trail from Mineral Springs Road to SR 49 is closed April 15th through the middle of June. There will be no public access through this stretch during this time. Ride this section with extreme caution.']

description: ['Highway 244 will be closed to through traffic from 10/2/23 through early summer 2024. Access to Mount Rushmore will remain open via U.S. Highway 16A and Highway 244 from the east. A detour will be installed around the project along U.S. 16.']
title: ['Highway 244 Closed to Through Traffic']

description: ['Do not drive on Hart Mine Road. Missing culverts are hazardous for all vehicles and road is subject to sudden collapse. Please do not drive around signed barricades.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.', 'Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.']
title: ['Hart Mine Road CLOSED due to collapsed culverts', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely', 'Use Caution on Roads with Debris']

description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]

description: ['Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. description: ['In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. description: ['CO Dept. of Transportation has closed US Highway 50 in both directions between County Road 26 and Elk Creek Road (16 to 20 miles west of Gunnison) from mile marker 136 to 140 for bridge work. Check https://www.cotrip.org/home for updates.', 'The North Rim Road is still closed to cars for the season beyond the gate at the northern park boundary. It is expected to open in early May 2024. Tomichi Point parking lot and viewpoint will be closed for the month of April.', 'Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the visitor center. Drive with extra caution. More road work in 2025.', 'Road construction and closures will continue in 2024. The project is located on US Highway 50 between mileposts 123 and 127, approx. 30 miles east of Montrose, Colorado. Refer to www.us50info.com for updated construction information.']

description: ['Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.', 'GPS apps on mobile devices may direct visitors to "Grand Canyon-Parashant" who type "Grand Canyon" into their driving directions. Roads across Parashant require 4-wheel drive and all-terrain tires. There are no visitor services or cell reception here.']
title: ['Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.', 'Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about GPS navigation using mobile devices.']

description: ['Be alert, especially this time of year around Mammoth Hot Springs. Elk calves may be hidden close to buildings, under or next to vehicles, and around blind corners. You must remain at least 25 yards from all wildlife. If an elk charges, retreat!', 'West Entrance to Old Faithful, Mammoth Hot Springs to Old Faithful, and Norris Junction to Canyon Village are open for the summer season. Additional park roads will open throughout May, weather permitting.', 'Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.']
title: ['Elk With Calves Are Extremely Dangerous', 'Select Roads Open to Regular Vehicles', 'Vehicle Entrance Reservation Not Needed']

description: ['Franklin Canyon Park is CLOSED until further notice at both entrances. Park is CLOSED to all vehicles and pedestrians at both entrances due to hazardous conditions.']
title: ['Franklin Canyon Park is Closed until further notice.']

description: ['The Calumet Trail from Mineral Springs Road to SR 49 is closed April 15th through the middle of June. There will be no public access through this stretch during this time. The closure is needed to modernize the trail by raising it and paving it.', 'The section of trail from the Dune Park Train Station to East State Park Road is in very poor condition with large, deep puddles of standing water and sections with larger gravel stones. Ride this section with extreme caution.']

description: ['The ferry dock servicing the Cape Lookout Lighthouse area is closed for repairs. Visitors will have to use an alternative route on the beach to access the boardwalk. Visitors should wear sturdy, closed toe shoes because of potential hazards.']
title: ['Passenger Ferry Dock Closed']

description: ['On 2/29 Eastbound Morris St. will be closed down to one lane starting at Ridgedale Ave for about 140 days. Westbound Morris St will closed to all traffic starting at the intersection of Ford Ave and Taft Lane. Please plan alternate routes.', "Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]
title: ['Morristown road closures beginning 29 February', 'Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']

description: ['Do not drive on Hart Mine Road. Missing culverts are hazardous for all vehicles and road is subject to sudden collapse. Please do not drive around signed barricades.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.', 'Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.']

Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
description: ['Colorado Department of Transportation has closed US Highway 50 near Dillon Pinnacles, between Black Canyon NP and Curecanti NRA (mile marker 136 to 138), for emergency maintenance on the bridge. Check https://www.cotrip.org/home for updates.', 'The North Rim Road is still closed to cars for the season beyond the gate at the northern park boundary. It is expected to open in early May 2024. The South Rim Drive beyond the visitor center and East Portal Road are open for the season.', 'Phase one of this major road improvement project starts April 1, 2024 with alternating one-way traffic (15-minute stops/delays) starting at the park entrance on Hwy 347. Tomichi Point parking lot and viewpoint will be closed for the month of April.', 'Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the visitor center. Drive with extra caution. More road work in 2025.', 'Road construction and closures will continue in 2024. The project is located on US Highway 50 between mileposts 123 and 127, approx. 30 miles east of Montrose, Colorado. Refer to www.us50info.com for updated construction information.']

description: ['The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. description: ['In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']

description: ['Desert tortoises are active in the spring and will sometimes cross the road. Please drive cautiously and obey the speed limit. To learn more about this iconic species, why they are threatened today, and what to do if you see one, click the link below.']

description: ['The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. title: ['Williams Ranch Road Closed', "Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike"]

description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.', 'El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.', 'High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']
title: ['West and East Border Roads closed for public safety', 'Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed', 'Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only']

description: ['In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']
title: ['South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available', 'Parking is not permitted on the Kyles Landing Road (County Road 56)', 'Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches']

description: ['The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.']
title: ['River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice']

description: ['Cima Road between Kelso Cima Road in Cima and Interstate 15 along the north preserve boundary is CLOSED to all vehicles. Please do not drive around barricades, or cross this active construction zone in the Cima Dome area.', 'Hart Mine Road is missing several wooden culverts the burned in the 2023 York Fire. THe road may appear intact but could cave in under the weight of a vehicle. Stay off Hart Mine Road for your safety.', 'Mojave National Preserve Road Crews will be repairing a problematic low water crossing ~2 miles north of the Junction of Cedar Canyon Road. Minor Delays are expected.']

Park Full Name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area
description: ['Old Mine Road between Millbrook Village and Worthington State Forest will be closed for the 2024 summer season for a pavement rehabilitation project. Please see news releases for more information.']
title: ['Old Mine Road South Closed for Rehabilitation Project']

description: ['Beginning on May 6, through May 12 at the latest, the Park Road and all backcountry units west of the Teklanika River bridge (Mile 31) will be closed for bear collaring operations. The closure applies to all pedestrians, bicyclists, and backcountry users.', 'The Denali Park Road is currently open to Mile 30, Teklanika River. If wintry conditions occur, the road may close at some point closer to the park entrance.', 'Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.']
title: ['Upcoming Closure', 'Road Open to: Mile 30 (Teklanika River)', 'Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide']

description: ['Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.']
title: ['Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended']

description: ['Gorge Road, from the Gulpha Gorge Campground entrance to Sleepy Valley will be closed for paving starting Sun., April 28 at 8:00 p.m., weather permitting. This segment of the road will remain closed for at least a few days until paving operations finish.']
title: ['Gorge Road Closure for Paving']

description: ['Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. For updates on the road and trails, click "More" below.']
title: ['Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage']

description: ["Vehicles longer than 24 feet are not permitted past the visitor center on Bonita Canyon Drive. Vehicles up to 29 feet are still allowed to stay in the campground, but can't go further. Parking for large vehicles and trailers is available at Faraway Ranch."]
title: ['Vehicle Length Limits']

description: ['South Cut Trail is closed between the main road and Killman Field trail due to washout along the trail. Detour for that section is along Killman Field trail. South Cut trail from Killman Field trail to the beach is open.']
title: ['South Cut trail Partially Closed']

description: ['NPS 300 to Big Tubes is dry with\xa0some two-foot-deep ruts. A four-wheel-drive, high clearance vehicle is required.', "The El Malpais Visitor Center will be closed on Monday, May 13, through Wednesday, May 15, 2024, for seasonal staff training. The park's roads and hiking trails are all open to visit while the visitor center is closed. Thank you for your understanding."]
title: ['NPS 300 Road Conditions', 'El Malpais Visitor Center closed May 13-15']

description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']
title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']

description: ['County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.']
title: ['County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday']

description: ['Lassen National Park Highway connecting the north and south park entrances is CLOSED to vehicles. Vehicles can still access two park entrances. One at the northwest and the other at the southwest entrances throughout the snow season. Learn more.', 'Inclement weather may cause unexpected delays, closures and possibly hazardous road conditions. The visitor center phone line may be unavailable.']
title: ['Lassen National Park Highway is CLOSED for the season', 'Changing conditions']

description: ["The Marconi Beach stairs will be demo'ed and replaced between 4/30-5/23 and will reopen for Memorial Day weekend. For public safety and to allow the contractor to work unimpeded, the entrance road and parking area will be closed for the duration.", 'Between 3/11-5/18, the Pilgrim Heights parking area and access roadways in Truro will be temporarily closed to allow for repaving and survey work. 24-hour vehicle and pedestrian closures will be in place during this time.']
title: ['Marconi Stairs/Beach Closed 4/30-5/23', 'Pilgrim Heights Parking Area and Access Closed 3/11-5/18']

description: ['The National Park Service is imposing a temporary closure of a portion of the Potomac Heritage National Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge during construction activities. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.']
title: ['Potomac Heritage National Trail Closed at Glebe Road for construction activities']

description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']
title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']

description: ['Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.']
title: ['Warning about GPS Systems!']

description: ['Desert tortoises are active in the spring and will sometimes cross the road. Please drive cautiously and obey the speed limit. To learn more about this iconic species, why they are threatened today, and what to do if you see one, click the link below.']
title: ['Watch Out for Tortoises on the Road']

description: ["Crews will perform crack sealing and similar minor repairs on Arches' paved park road this summer. Visitors may encounter brief delays or reduced availability in some parking lots.", 'All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1 or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.']
title: ['Road repairs may occur 4/29 to 8/1; brief delays possible', 'Seasonal climbing closures in effect']

description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']
title: ['Secure trash and food']

Park Full Name: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument
description: ['Don’t get your vehicle stuck at the Painted Hills! We want you and your RV or large bus to enjoy your trip. Travel trailers or large buses are not recommended beyond the Overlook Trail at Painted Hills due to limited turning radius.']
title: ['Painted Hills- Large RV or Travel Trailer not Recommended Beyond Overlook Trail']

description: ['The Calumet Trail from Mineral Springs Road to SR 49 is closed April 15th through the middle of June. There will be no public access through this stretch during this time. The closure is needed to modernize the trail by raising it and paving it.', 'The section of trail from the Dune Park Train Station to East State Park Road is in very poor condition with large, deep puddles of standing water and sections with larger gravel stones. Ride this section with extreme caution.']
title: ['Portion of Calumet Trail Closed', 'Poor Trail Conditions on the Calumet Bike Trail']

description: ['Beginning Sunday, March 10th, 2024, main park roads will be open to vehicular traffic from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.', 'Fort Heiman is located at 682 Fort Heiman Road, New Concord KY. Due to poor conditions of county roads, the County has posted the loop road closed to vehicles past the park pavilion. Pedestrian access is permitted.']
title: ['Main Park Roads Open to Vehicular Traffic Starting March 10', 'County road through the Fort Heiman Unit is Closed to Vehicles Past the Pavilion']

description: ["Crews will perform crack sealing and similar minor repairs on Canyonlands' paved park road this summer. description: ['Volcano Road will have short closures for construction May 8 and May 15 or 16. description: ['The full backcountry vehicle route remains closed for the winter season until May 15. Vehicle access is limited to the Cabin District.']
title: ['Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season']

description: ['From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']
title: ['Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']

description: ['Scheduled bridge replacement on Hopetown Road will impact visitor use at the Hopeton Earthworks parking lot. The parking lot will not be accessible to foot or vehicle traffic starting Sunday, May 5 thru at least May 11. Contact the park for more info.']

description: ["Due to damage and unsafe conditions caused by recent storms, a staircase and access route from the Park Loop Road to Little Hunter's Beach is closed until further notice. description: ['The Green River Ferry Status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information please call the Green River Ferry Hotline at (270) 758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter feed. 2 vehicle limit.']
title: ['Green River Ferry Status']

description: ['Four miles of trail along the carriage road corridors have been designated as ‘Multi-Use Trails’ in winter – walkers are permitted to use these trails free of charge. All other trails require a day/season pass from the Woodstock Inn. See link for details.']

description: ['Visitors can access the park via Highway 143 and the town of Brian Head. You can view Cedar Breaks from the Northview Overlook. State Route 143 will remain open, weather permitting. On April 22, the seasonal snowmobile trail will close.']

description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. description: ['Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.']
title: ['Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway']

description: ["Please be advised of potential delays or route obstructions to the Wilson's Creek National Battlefield Entrance from Hwy ZZ starting Monday, September 18th. Entering Wilson's Creek National Battlefield from Farm Road 182 via Battlefield may be faster."]
title: ['Occasional lane closures and traffic delays due to construction at Hwy ZZ & Farm Rd 182']

Park Full Name: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]
title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']

description: ['Due to soil and vegetation damage caused by off-road vehicle travel near Amistad Acres, undesignated dirt loop roads in the area are closed to vehicle traffic until further notice. The area will remain open to foot traffic.']

description: ['The Santa Rosa Parking lots along Highway 399, numbers 32A and 33A and currently closed to the public for resurfacing and restriping.']

description: ['During the month of April, a section of boardwalk near Sailors Haven marina will be inaccessible due to repair work. Visitors walking the trail should use the west end trail entrances and walk an out-and-back route, as loop walks will not be possible.']
title: ['Sections of Sunken Forest Boardwalk Inaccessible During Repair Work']

description: ['The Visitor Center is CLOSED between April 21 and May 4 for staff training. Visit the link for available visitor services/hours of operation. The North Rim of the park and SR 67 remain CLOSED to all vehicle traffic until May 15.']
title: ["What's Closed and What's Open? (Park Operational Updates) Monday, April 29, 2024"]

description: ['Due to washout and bad road conditions Slant Rock Road has been closed to all traffic aside from hikers and bikers. To access Slant Rock, park your vehicle at the hunting inspection station off of Road 103.']
title: ['Slant Rock Road Closed to Vehicular Traffic']

description: ['Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.', 'GPS apps on mobile devices may direct visitors to "Grand Canyon-Parashant" who type "Grand Canyon" into their driving directions. Roads across Parashant require 4-wheel drive and all-terrain tires. There are no visitor services or cell reception here.']
title: ['Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.', 'Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about GPS navigation using mobile devices.']

description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']
title: ['Trail Conditions']

description: ['Cascade River Road is closed for the winter season at milepost 20 (El Dorado parking lot), three miles before the trailhead.', 'Prevent smashed windows and theft. description: ['Due to previous storm damage, the trail has been closed until the park can re-route it to a better location. description: ['Due to increased visitation, parking lots often fill up early. Visitors need to be aware that parking for larger vehicles is very limited. RVs using "tow dollies" may have to unhook towed vehicles in order to turn around in the parking lot on busy days.']

description: ['The highway 137 bridge landing sustained flood damage in 2019 and the landing restoration by NDOT has been completed. The area is smaller than in the past and the access to the water is steeper. Use caution when accessing the landing']

description: ['Spring weather is variable at Mesa Verde. Snow and ice can delay opening the main park road. Trails often become muddy or closed due to rain or late snow melt. Current info is available at the Visitor and Resource Center. Click the link below for update']
title: ['Spring Conditions']

title: ['Use Caution with GPS Navigation']

description: ['Spring is upon us, we expect high visitation at Saguaro National Park during March, April, & May. There is limited parking at the Rincon Mountain Visitor Center (east side). Large vehicles may find difficulty parking on the east side. Call for more info.', "Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity."]
title: ['High Visitation during the months of March, April, and May', 'Vehicle Break-Ins']

description: ['The gate to Paradise at Longmire is open and will close overnight. The uphill gate at Longmire will close at 4pm. The downhill gate at Longmire will close at 5pm. All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD, are required to carry tire chains Nov 1 - May 1', 'All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD vehicles, must carry tire chains in the park during the winter season (November 1 - May 1) and be prepared to use them when tire chain requirements are posted.']
title: ['Paradise Road Status on 04/29/2024: Road Open', 'All vehicles are required to carry tire chains Nov 1 - May 1 when traveling in the park.']

Park Full Name: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area
description: ['Franklin Canyon Park is CLOSED until further notice at both entrances. Park is CLOSED to all vehicles and pedestrians at both entrances due to hazardous conditions.']
title: ['Franklin Canyon Park is Closed until further notice.']

description: ['USA Cycling Colligate Road National Competitions will make Atrisco Visa Boulevard and Volcanoes Day Use Area inaccessible for most of May 3rd. Access to Volcanoes Day Use Area will be available from 12 pm to 12:30 pm and after 2:30 from Paseo del Norte.', "This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. title: ['Atrisco Vista Boulevard and Volcanoes Day Use Area Closed May 3rd', 'Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']
